meanings.definition: A person who writes letters or emails to someone else
meanings.sent1: My pen pal is a great correspondent, always sending me updates on her life.
meanings.sent2: The correspondent sent a heartfelt letter to her friend who lived far away.
meanings.sent3: The diligent correspondent made sure to reply to every email within a day.
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed like a river in the letters she penned as a correspondent.
meanings.sent5: The correspondent's messages were like a warm hug in written form.

meanings.definition: A person who contributes news or commentary to a newspaper or broadcast
meanings.sent1: The newspaper correspondent reported on the local events with accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The TV correspondent delivered breaking news to viewers around the world.
meanings.sent3: The correspondent's witty remarks always added a touch of humor to the news.
meanings.sent4: Her voice as a correspondent echoed through the airwaves, reaching countless listeners.
meanings.sent5: The correspondent's investigative skills uncovered the truth behind the story.

meanings.definition: In agreement or harmony with; matching or equivalent to
meanings.sent1: The color of the curtains was correspondent to the sofa in the living room.
meanings.sent2: His actions were correspondent to his words, showing his integrity.
meanings.sent3: The cake's sweetness was correspondent to the smiles it brought to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the garden was correspondent to a painting come to life.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song was correspondent to the beating of my heart.
